source_note: Statewide baseline derived from public program guidance; local rules may be stricter.

organics.guidance: Residential and commercial organics separation program required statewide. Use green bin where available; check city for accepted items (food scraps, yard trimmings, soiled paper).
organics.notes: Some cities accept meat/dairy; others do not.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Clean paper and flattened cardboard generally accepted in curbside recycling.
paper_cardboard.notes: No food-soiled pizza boxes unless your city allows in organics.

glass_containers.guidance: Glass bottles and jars generally accepted curbside if empty and rinsed.
glass_containers.notes: Caps and lids rules vary by city.

metal_containers.guidance: Aluminum and steel/tin cans generally accepted curbside if empty and rinsed.
metal_containers.notes: Aerosols: check local program; often HHW if not fully empty.

plastics.guidance: Bottles, jugs, and tubs commonly accepted. Other plastics vary by city; check local list.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags/film NOT curbside; take-back at participating stores.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: CRV-eligible beverage containers can be redeemed at CRV sites; also typically recyclable curbside.

household_batteries.guidance: Do NOT place in trash or curbside recycling. Use HHW collection or retail take-back.

e_waste.guidance: Electronics are NOT curbside. Use e-waste collection events or certified drop-off.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: NOT accepted in curbside recycling. Use retail store drop-off (if offered) or landfill.

bulky_items.guidance: Schedule bulky pickup with your hauler or take to approved facility.
